page.title: 04Wareham today 1985 - 2
page.content: Wareham is a{commercial centre}being the only main town serving the local villages between Poole, Swanage and Dorchester. The development of a new shopping centre and the new Wareham by-pass; which has greatly eased the traffic congestion which in Wareham has made the town a much more relaxing place to be in. Tourists can now enjoy and appreciate a much more relaxed stay in Wareham than was possible 5 years ago. The outlying area to the North West of Wareham is mainly heath land. The land area is split by the river Piddle (Trent). {Large sections of the block {are given over to Forest and gravel {mining. }There are{no other villages or small towns within the area.
